My industry contributions Aare as board member of HIMSS India, leading the Women in Health IT committee, with the mission of enabling Healthcare with technology. My favorite moment was speaking on an India panel at Cannes Lions festival, France. I was honored by the Chief Minister of Kerala for work with the Startup ecosystem and nominated to Sthree Shakthi award, a recognition for women who have impacted the society.

Atsushi is CEO of MOONGIFT Inc. in Japan. He is Ruby and JavaScript/Node.js Programmer.
Atsushi manages Website named [MOONGIFT](https://www.moongift.jp/) that introduce Open source Software everyday to Japanese programmers from 2004. It is the biggest Open source information site in Japan.
He started DevRel agency since 2015, and has a knowledge of how to create content for programmers. He also has several communities involved developer relations in APAC such as DevRel Meetup in Tokyo, Singapore, Bangalore and Taipei. He is mainly organizer of DevRelCon Tokyo since 2017 and co-organizerd DevRelCon Earth 2020 and DevRel/Japan 2019.

profile_your_language.profile_english:
Elastic Technical Product Marketing Manager/Evangelist.
Iâ€™d joined Microsoft Japan in 2003 and had been a Technical Architect in the public sector sales department, where he was responsible for raising awareness of .NET technology.
In 2006, I had been transferred to the Developer Marketing Division, where I worked for 10 years as a technical evangelist in charge of technology education for iOS/Android and Microsoft Azure developers. 
After retiring from Microsoft Japan, I worked for Dell, Accenture, and others, and was appointed as an Executive Advisor to the Government CIO of the Cabinet Secretariat in April 2019. 
I have been leading the planning, development, and design of new government systems to realize the Declaration of the Most Advanced IT Nation from a cloud-by-default perspective.
After serving as an evangelist at Cloud Venture in a dual role with an Executive Advisor to the Government CIO, I began working at Elastic in June 2020 and has been consistently involved in technology awareness activities and developer technology awareness for 17 years.

profile_your_language.profile_english: Don Goodman-Wilson, Founder is a philosopher-engineer who focuses on ethics in tech and empowering software maintainers. Don is the founder of the [DevRel Salon](https://www.devrel.salon/), sits on the board of the [Maintainerati Foundation](https://maintainerati.org/), and is an active contributor to the [Ethical Source Working Group](https://ethicalsource.dev/). In previous lives, Don has worked with startups in such diverse fields as open source development, web security, chatbots, streaming media, embedded hardware, and the Japanese model railroading industry; he also holds a Ph.D. in philosophy from Washington University in St. Louis. Don enjoys statically typed languages and sailing, lives with his wife and daughter in Amsterdam, a laments the passing of shibuya-kei.

profile_your_language.profile_english:
Juyoung Song is a DevOps Engineer at weverse and AWS Container hero. 
He is currently in charge of creating into modern cloud architecture to bring global stars such as BTS and millions of fans together in the digital sphere.

Previously he was at Samsung Electronics as a DevOps Engineer where he shared best practices and migration of modern cloud architectures. 

Juyoung has spoken regularly at AWS-organized events such as AWS Container Day, AWS Summit, and This is My Architecture. 
Furthermore, he organized and spoke at various Meetups like AWS Korea User Group and DevOps Korea, about topics such as ECS and Fargate, and its DevOps best practices. 
Also Juyoung is an leading opensource "project DevOps Art" with colleagues.

His goal is to grow from DevOps engineer to DevOps producer, and ultimately DevOps Artist to maximize performance, work-emotion, cost, tools and methodology to build cloud-native services.

I introduce examples of DevRel activities with content marketing such as "Tech Blogs", which I learn through practice my daily communication with developers.

profile_your_language.profile_english:
Paresh Mayani is currently working as Practice Head at Simform Solutions Private Limited. He has been exploring the horizon of software industry and developers community since last 10+ years. He is a founder/organizer of Google Developers Group, Ahmedabad, one of the senior most organiser in India, organising events and helping out fellow organisers across India since last 7-8 years.

He is an avid Open source enthusiast, who has been organising events as well as blogging, speaking and mentoring on various topics since 2010. He can be frequently found giving talks on various topics ranging from Community leadership, Community Management, Events organising, and mobile development, mobile app UI/UX and best practices at Domestic & International conferences such as Android Developer Days Turkey (Droidcon Ankara), DevFest Kathmandu, GDG DevCamp Colombo  and NitroDroid.

He has been actively supporting his fellow android developers through various online and offline means. His has published more than 150 articles on his blog TechnoTalkative on which he writes about various technical solutions for Android Development. He holds 100,000+ reputation on StackOverflow, where he is also in 10 highest reputation holders for Android tag.

He is also been nominated for the Google Developers Expert for Android program. He was invited to attend the Google IO 2016 event at Mountain View, California.

profile_your_language.profile_english: Aditya Oberai is a junior pursuing Computer Science and Engineering at Amity University, Noida. Having worked with various technologies recently such as Xamarin.Forms application development, Microsoft Azure, etc., he spends most of his time working in the student developer and hackathon communities as a Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador. Aditya has been directly involved in the organization of three major virtual hackathons DecentralHacks, HackOn and Ami-Hacks and was the winner of the first-ever Microsoft Visual Studio Code Hackathon as well. Aditya has been awarded an Azure Heroes "Community Hero" Digital Badger by Microsoft. He was also the Volunteer Team Lead at ng-India 2020. Aditya formerly worked as a Community Intern at Progate.

profile_your_language.profile_english: Renaldi Gondosubroto is the Founder of GReS Studio and a Developer Advocate in the tech community. His personal vision is to be able to get more young minds into taking leadership positions in the companies that will come. Through his passion of developing software and contributing to the opensource community, Renaldi wants to encourage the innovation of new solutions to usher forward and promote a new era of innovations that can be used by everyone. He enjoys sharing his knowledge regarding his experiences within the tech industry with many other people in order to also inspire and put them in the right track for success, both in conferences and in regular everyday situations. As part of this, he has been a tech speaker in numerous events for the past four years and runs tech meetups and workshops to promote better understanding of technical skills. In his free time, he also enjoys track running and playing chess.

Cherish Santoshi is a writer, speaker and a Program Manager. He is currently working with HackerEarth, managing programs for a community of 4 million developers globally. 
He started working in DevRel space 6 years ago and have strategized & managed programs for companies like Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Government of India, etc. In the last year, he worked directly with over 100,000 developers and 50+ companies to create meaningful projects and brilliant products.
Cherish firmly believes that communities can change the world by igniting revolutionary innovation and progress.

profile_your_language.profile_english: An ecosystem builder, working at Gojek Singapore, Vaibhavi describes herself as an explorer, learner and leader. She currently runs the Data & Diversity programs at Gojek, impacting multiple products & teams at scale. Previously, she worked at Google in Singapore and India where she initiated and scaled multiple programs around Machine Learning, Computer Science education, D&I and more - for enterprises, startups and developer communities across India, Southeast Asia, EMEA and LATAM markets. Being a Google Women Techmakers Scholar herself, her personal crusade revolves around getting more women involved in tech â€“ whether they are school children, office professionals, home makers or elderly women - collaborating with various NGOs in Singapore and India on various projects. Outside of work, Vaibhavi is a keen reader, loving the mythological poems and stories of ancient India and discovering how the stories could fit in our modern world. Not only does she enjoy the written word, she has always been a keen dancer, learning kathak, a classical Indian dance form.

profile_your_language.profile_english: Sandra Persing is the co-founder and producer of DevRel Summit leadership conference, the executive producer of View Source Conference, founder of Women Who Code CONNECT, and confidently claims on having once produced over 57 Developer Roadshows in one year. In the recent five years, Sandra served as the Global Strategist for DevRel Events and Sponsorship at Mozilla, investing in projects and platforms that connect millions of developers annually on the web and onsite at conferences. Having served many years as an Advocate, then Director, for Women Who Code, Sandra currently serves on the Advisory Board and speaks on the importance of women in leadership roles, including within the ever-evolving business of developer relations at industry events. Sandra earned her MBA in Management Consulting at Cornell University and her BA at Wellesley College. She once had the title of frequent flier with multiple international airlines and now enjoys best long weekends at home with her boys and family on the West Coast. Read more of her musings on https://medium.com/@SandraPersing

profile_your_language.profile_english:
Giri Kuncoro is currently working for Gojek, one of the fastest growing unicorns in South East Asia. He is focusing on containers, Kubernetes, and cloud native infrastructure. Giri is also an ambassador for the Cloud Native Computing Foundation and Google Developer Expert. Previously, he was an early engineer for Pivotal Container Service and VMware Kubernetes Engine projects in Silicon Valley. He is a Kubernetes (docs) maintainer and part of the Kubernetes release engineering team.

Giri organizes a sub-special interest group to localize Kubernetes docs to Indonesian language, and is a leader in the community. He is known to organize monthly Kubernetes/CloudNative meetups and workshops in Jakarta as well as few other cities. He obtained his Master in Computer and Information Science from Cornell University, recognized with excellence award. Giri lives in Jakarta and spends his free time playing piano.
